answers.answer: I think it is odd. I even get my urine checked for a standard gyn visit. I def. would ask next visit.
I give a urine sample on every visit I go into. I dunno. I think it varies on the doctor really.
I think that's odd. Before I mc, that was the 1st thing they did b4 I even went from waiting room to office on every visit.

My doctor doesn't check my urine either, he didn't with my last pregnancy either.  When I went to my other ob with my other pregnancies they did it rountinely, but when I asked him why he doesn't, he simply stated, unless I was having any problems, like burning (UTI) or sugar, and swelling, it really wasn't necessary.  My last pregnancy progressed just fine, and I am in my 35th week with this one, so I really wouldn't worry to much.  I am sure they know what they are doing, especially if it is reputable doctor that has been in practice awhile.  Best of luck to you!

I am pretty sure that is kind of standard to check it. It helps to check for sugar and protien in the urine which are indicators of gestational diabetes and preclampsia (which I'm sure you already know). Perhaps some docs wait til later in a pregnancy to test for those things, but I'd think you are far enough along now that they would want to check. I would probably just ask the nurse the next time you go why they aren't checking your urine. Mine gets checked each time for protien, glucose and then they check for a UTI for me b/c I am prone to them this pregnancy. (yay me) lol

With my last pregnancy, my midwife checked my urine every visit. With this pregnancy and my OB, he started checking I think at like my 32nd week and then I've given a sample since then. I too thought this was really wierd, and even asked the nurse. She said the other doc in the practice gets one at every visit, but it was just style and choice and mine didn't worry about it unless something else was going on until the last two week visits and beyond.
Odd, I am pregnant now and give a sample every time I go to dr

Most probably do get a sample every time, but in actuality it probably isn't necessary.  You will be tested for gest. diabetes regardless of what the urine shows (if you are spilling sugar or not), and your blood pressure checks will show if you might be developing pregnancy induced hypertension--in which case the appropriate blood tests will be ordered for that.Women can spill glucose and/or protein in their urine and it might not mean a thing...and vice versa.  So while urine checks are usually done, it's probably more from routine than from necessity.  Years ago, that was the best way to check.  Now there are better diagnostics, but old habits die hard.
With all five pregnancies I peed in a cup at every visit.

my first pg i didnt do a urine test every time, in fact i think maybe a total of 3 or 4 times....the second one i had to every timei personally think they do it just to be able to bill the insurance a zillion dollars for dipping a piece of litmus paper in your pee each time... unless there's signs of something wrong i never could find any reason cept for the money...  maybe thats just me tho...

Thanks guys--it helps to know that not every dr does this. My dr is reputable and probably about 60, so I feel he knows what he is doing. I might still mention it, but if some dr's just don't do it routinely, this must be the case with him.

Mine doesn't, either. Matter of fact, I've only had two regular OB visits since becoming pregnant and I am nearly 27 weeks. She has not even checked my fundal height, either. The only time I have had my urine checked was when I was having UTI symptoms and now I am on Macrobid for the rest of the pregnancy for them. This is very different from my last pregnancies, but I am treating in a different location now. My OB doc has been in the field for a long time and I think her take on it is just that pregnancy is a normal process and unless there are problems, to let it happen naturally. She doesn't do a whole lot of checking for things or testing so if she doesn't worry, I guess I don't.

question: I know that with my other children, the dr I had then had me give a urine sample EVERY visit. The dr I have now has NEVER had me do so.Is that normal? Or do all of you give a urine sample at your dr visits?
title: Dr. never tests urine-normal?
